introduction.heading: Introduction
introduction.first_sentence: Beta-tricalcium phosphate (β-TCP) bioceramic granules have been employed in clinical trials as a bone replacement material because they exhibit a high rate of new bone creation after being implanted in a bone defect.

introduction.last_sentence: As a result, the goal of this study is to determine the osteoinductivity ability of DCPD-coated porous β-TCP granules in adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells (ADMSCs), in vitro.

conclusions.heading: Conclusions
conclusions.first_sentence: DCPD-coated porous β-TCP granules have good biocompatibility and high osteoinductivity ability in ADMSCs, which makes them promise alveolar bone graft biomaterials that may support alveolar bone defect regeneration.
